column6: Interactions with water as a shared resource
column13: MinRes maintains Drinking Water Management Plans (MPs), Groundwater Operating Strategies, and Surface Water MPs as required at each operational mine site, which define how MinRes implements monitoring programs to assess operational performance, verify compliance with adopted performance criteria, facilitate reporting requirements and track water quality parameters that have the potential to cause adverse environmental or community health impacts.
column20: Drinking Water Management Plans, Groundwater Operating Strategies, monitoring program

column6: Interactions with water as a shared resource
column13: MinRes has a dedicated Water Working Group responsible for matters and activities related specifically to managing, conserving, and preserving water resources located within and adjacent to MinRes's operations. The Working Group supports the implementation of water accounting and efficiency projects, aligns to progress effective water stewardship, advances water performance reporting and provides a consultation mechanism to raise water governance issues and queries.
column20: Water Working Group, water resource, water accounting

column13: MinRes conducts comprehensive baseline assessments and modelling during the planning stages of its projects and, as required, during the life of the mine. These assessments are pivotal in water management planning, risk identification and mitigation, infrastructure design, community engagement and consultation, and regulatory environmental compliance.
column20: Baseline assessment, water management planning, infrastructure design

column13: On-site water efficiency audits have been completed across MinRes' Wodgina, Mt Marion, Iron Valley and Yilgarn Iron Ore operations, with remaining operational sites planned for FY24. Improvement programs will be developed for some operations to increase water monitoring capability, assessing appropriate upgrades to MinRes' water monitoring infrastructure and determining investment avenues to better its water management.
column20: Water efficiency audit, water monitoring, water management

column7: MinRes withdrew 23,924 ML of groundwater in 2023.
MinRes discharged 19,177 ML of water in 2023.

column6: Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
column13: MinRes undertakes biodiversity risk assessments during operational phases and as part of expanding mining activities. Site-specific environmental commitments are outlined as part of the conditions of environmental approval. Following Part IV of the EP Act, MinRes implements EMPs for the management, monitoring and reporting processes associated with the environmental impacts of approved operations and activities, where applicable.
column20: Biodiversity risk assessment, environmental commitment, environmental approval

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: As required under the EP Act, MinRes undertakes ecological surveys of biodiversity values, including for local flora and fauna, with the support of external consultants to assist in developing environmental impact assessments. When undertaking these assessments, MinRes consults with all relevant and affected stakeholders, including Traditional Owners, Federal and State government authorities and local communities. Consultation and collaboration with stakeholders are ongoing throughout the lifecycle of MinRes' operations to develop integrated approaches to minimise and rehabilitate impacted areas effectively.
column20: Ecological survey, biodiversity value, flora, fauna

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: MinRes undertook drone seeding trials broken into one-hectare sections across six hectares on a newly rehabilitated landform at Jackson 1, located at its Yilgarn Iron Ore Operations. Bentonite pellets containing local provenance seeds were spread at controlled rates and within controlled areas, including various trials of 2kg to 8kg of pelleted seed.
column20: Drone seeding, rehabilitated landform, local provenance seed

column13: During FY23, MinRes developed a dedicated biodiversity function to coordinate developing and implementing a corporate Biodiversity Strategy and ecological research programs in key biodiversity areas. Currently undergoing internal subject matter expert review, the Biodiversity Strategy aims to set out the principles and proposed actions by which MinRes aims to manage its collective interactions with biodiversity, identify and evaluate its environmental impacts, apply the mitigation hierarchy framework, and track progress against environmental targets and goals.
column20: Biodiversity Strategy, biodiversity area, environmental impact

column6: IUCN Red List species and national conversation list species with habitats in areas affected by operations
column13: MinRes' Rehabilitation Strategy aligns with the United Nations Decade on Ecosystem Restoration 2021Ã¢ÂÂ2030, developed "to support and scale up efforts to prevent, halt, and reverse the degradation of ecosystems worldwide and raise awareness of the importance of successful ecosystem restoration". MinRes' Rehabilitation Strategy sets standards to define outcomes for core activities associated with rehabilitation planning and design phases, including waste management, topsoil medium management, landform construction and revegetation.
column20: Rehabilitation Strategy, ecosystem restoration, rehabilitation planning

column7: MinRes's scope 1 emissions in 2023 were 373,461 tCO2e.
MinRes's scope 2 emissions in 2023 were 3,490 tCO2e.
MinRes has yet to disclose this information due to information unavailability.

column13: MinRes commissioned a pilot study using the Hydi hydrogen on-demand technology installed on a subset of road haulage trucks operating in the Yilgarn. The primary purpose of the pilot study was to test the feasibility and practicality of the system and collect data to confirm emissions reduction potential under operational conditions. The Hydi system provides hydrogen gas to the diesel engine's intake.
column20: Hydi hydrogen, haulage truck, emissions reduction

column8: Future Energy Exports Cooperative Research Centre
column13: MinRes has been a partner in the Future Energy Exports Cooperative Research Centre (CRC) since its inception in 2020. The Federal Government has provided $40 million over 10 years to support the Centre, and MinRes is a partner in the CRC along with 28 other industry, government and research partners. The CRC aims to "Future-proof Australia's energy exports through industrial scale innovation". MinRes' contribution to the Future Energy Export's Cooperative Research Centre Kwinana Energy Transformation Hub (KETH) project ended in FY23. MinRes remains a big advocate for the project and looks forward to the output of the recent $15 million injection into the Kwinana clean energy project.
column20: Future Energy Exports Cooperative Research Centre, Kwinana Energy Transformation Hub, clean energy project

column13: To manage air emissions at its operations, MinRes applies dust suppression measures such as water carts in high-traffic areas, roads and tracks and sprinkler systems installed on transfer points at its crushing and train load-out facilities. MinRes utilises dust deposition gauges as required by site-specific regulatory requirements to monitor the potential impacts of dust on the environment.
column20: Dust suppression, air emissions, water cart

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
column7: MinRes made 24,237 tonnes of air emissions in 2023.

column6: Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: MinRes' Environment Policy covers emissions to air, operational greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, water use, waste generation, biodiversity, land management and rehabilitation. The Policy is implemented through MinRes' Environmental Management System (EMS) and was developed in line with the ISO 14001 Environmental Management Systems standard.
column20: Environment Policy, emission, waste generation

column13: MinRes developed a Waste Strategy during FY22 with a specialist waste consultant to advance the business towards more efficient waste management practices and circular economy outcomes. The Waste Strategy seeks to utilise waste assets and resources most efficiently to maximise waste avoidance, waste reduction, and resource recovery in alignment, where possible, with the WA Waste Avoidance and Resource Recovery Strategy 2030
column20: Waste Strategy, waste consultant, waste management

column13: A total of 156,438 metric tonnes of solid and liquid waste was treated through wastewater treatment plants (WWTPs) operated at MinRes' Koolyanobbing, Windarling, Parker Range, Carina, Iron Valley, Wonmunna, Mt Marion, Wodgina and Onslow campsites. Treated septic waste is disposed of via licenced evaporation ponds or irrigation fields. Wastewater quality and volumes are monitored and reported as part of annual environmental reports and annual audit compliance reports submitted to regulators.
column20: Wastewater treatment plant, liquid waste, septic waste

column13: In 2020, the WA Government introduced a state-wide beverage container deposit program, Containers for Change, which helps ensure eligible containers are diverted from landfills. This program leads to cleaner recycling streams and improved resource recovery while supporting increased employment and fundraising opportunities. At the Kwinana Workshop and Wonmunna operations, MinRes supported the Containers for Change program with the source and separation of beverage containers for recycling at their nearest refund points. Funds received from the program will be donated to charity.
column20: Containers for Change, recycling stream, resource recovery

column13: During FY23, MinRes' Site Services and Procurement teams continued to progress in evaluating sustainable packaging options available for its business to reduce reliance on single-use plastics. MinRes continued to engage with eco-friendly WA-based suppliers and manufacturers. They rolled out a range of biodegradable food and beverage packaging solutions across all operation camps and its Perth-based corporate office. All MinRes' mining camps have transitioned to biodegradable packaging, diverting plastic waste from landfills.
column20: Sustainable packaging, biodegradable packaging, plastic waste

column13: During FY23, MinRes collaborated with the external waste contractor responsible for managing waste at its headquarters to conduct education sessions to enhance awareness of the various waste streams and appropriate item disposal. To tailor the education sessions effectively, MinRes deployed a survey to gauge employees' understanding and knowledge of waste segregation.
column20: Education session, waste contractor, waste stream

column7: MinRes generated 111,043,000 WMT of waste rock in 2023.
MinRes diverted 4,067 tonnes of non-hazardous waste from landfills.
MinRes directed 7,137 tonnes of non-hazardous waste to landfill.

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column13: In FY24, MinRes will introduce environmental questions as part of its new Social Responsibility and Ethical Sourcing Questionnaire. It replaces its current Modern Slavery Supplier Questionnaire. It aims to capture MinRes' suppliers' environmental risk profile.
column20: Environmental questions, Social Responsibility and Ethical Sourcing Questionnaire, supplier

column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: MinRes follows a risk-based approach to identify the types of suppliers with a higher risk of human rights abuses by utilising a third-party platform to conduct supply chain due diligence. All identified high-risk suppliers are issued with an SAQ to support this process. The responses are then assessed, with any risk areas remaining addressed with the supplier in a two-way dialogue.
column20: Supply chain due diligence, SAQ, supplier
